title: HSC begins as students sit English exams
text:
Tens of thousands of NSW students sitting their HSC are being urged to keep the exams in perspective and not "get too stressed out".

English exams begin on Thursday morning, with 123 written exams to be held during the HSC period that finishes on November 11.

Education Minister Sarah Mitchell wished the 75,000 students sitting the final year exams the best of luck, and said while it was natural for them to feel some pressure, they needed to keep the HSC in perspective.

"Make sure that you take time throughout this exam period to look after yourselves," Ms Mitchell told reporters in Sydney.

"Don't get too stressed out. Eat well, exercise, take some time out to do the things that you enjoy and if you are worried about any particular issue reach out for some support from your friends, your families or your teachers.

"There is a lot of us here that are backing you in. We know you will do a great job."
